answers.answer: There is not a great deal of difference among the different aspheric monofocal lenses.  Your surgeon will choose a lens he is experienced with and thinks would work best in your case.

I had surgery on my left eye I had the crystalens HD installed. It's been 32 hours sence surgery when they took the patch off my eye was real blury they had look through an eye cover wtih a bunch of little holes when i did that every thing was clear. Also i have have circle halo on any light i see. they said it would clear up after my eye wasn't dilated any more is this normal. Thanks

The little holes is called a "pinhole" aperture and its a quick way of checking for glasses. You can use the search feature and archives and read about the recovery process which many patients have described their post operative course.Hope all goes wellJCH MD

question: IM 55 years old and have cataracts in my left eye and stating in my right. Mine is the kind that groes fast IM type 2 diabetes. So many lenses how do know which one and what type.
title: Monofocal which one is best
